qas.question: What religious order was St. Francis Xavier in?
When was St. Francis Xavier born?
When did St. Francis Xavier die?
When did Xavier try to convert Japan to Christianity?
Who were the Japanese regarded as braver than?

answers.text: the people of China, Korea, Ternate and all of the other nations around the Philippines

context: Historian H. Paul Varley notes the description of Japan given by <a0_0>Jesuit<a0_0/> leader St. Francis Xavier (<a1_0>1506<a1_0/>–<a2_0>1552<a2_0/>): "There is no nation in the world which fears death less." Xavier further describes the honour and manners of the people: "I fancy that there are no people in the world more punctilious about their honour than the Japanese, for they will not put up with a single insult or even a word spoken in anger." Xavier spent the years <a3_0>1549–1551<a3_0/> converting Japanese to Christianity. He also observed: "The Japanese are much braver and more warlike than <a4_0>the people of China, Korea, Ternate and all of the other nations around the Philippines<a4_0/>."
